greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of rooted toroidal maps with n edges and k faces and without separating cycles or isthmuses, n >= 2, k = 1..n-1.
comment: The number of vertices is n-k.
Column k is a polynomial of degree 3*k. This is because adding a face can increase the number of vertices whose degree is greater than two by at most two.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..1276
T. R. S. Walsh and A. B. Lehman, Counting rooted maps by genus. III: Nonseparable maps, J. Combinatorial Theory Ser. B 18 (1975), 222-259, Table VIc.
program: H(n, g=1)={my(q=G(n, g, 'y, 'z)-x*(1+'z), v=Vec(polcoef(sqrt(serreverse(x/q^2)/x), g, 'y))); [Vecrev(t) | t<-v]}
results.author: _Andrew Howroyd_, Apr 04 2021
